verses.roman:
puruṣottame eka uḍiyā-brāhmaṇa-kumāra
pitṛ-śūnya, mahā-sundara, mṛdu-vyavahāra

synonyms: puruṣottame—in Jagannātha Purī; eka—one; uḍiyā-brāhmaṇa-kumāra—young son of a brāhmaṇa from Orissa; pitṛ-śūnya—without his father; mahā-sundara—possessing very beautiful bodily features; mṛdu-vyavahāra—having very gentle behavior.
translation: In Jagannātha Purī there was a young boy who had been born of an Orissa brāhmaṇa but had later lost his father. The boy's features were very beautiful, and his behavior was extremely gentle.
